resources.string: Crays Circle needs Bluetooth to connect with nearby devices
Crays Circle uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to create a mesh network with nearby devices. This allows messages to be sent and received without internet or phone service.
• Relay messages through the mesh network

Allow Crays Circle to run in the background

Crays Circle runs in the background to maintain mesh network connections with nearby devices. Battery optimization can interrupt these connections, causing messages to be delayed or missed.\n\nDisabling battery optimization ensures Crays Circle can reliably maintain connections and deliver messages.
Note: You can change this setting later in Android Settings > Apps > Crays Circle > Battery
Your device doesn\'t require battery optimization settings. Crays Circle will run normally.

Crays Circle can run reliably in the background

• Maintains reliable mesh network connections
• Ensures messages are delivered promptly
• Prevents missed messages from nearby users
• Keeps the app responsive in background
Crays Circle does NOT track your location or use GPS.\n\nLocation services are required by Android for Bluetooth scanning to work properly. This is an Android system requirement.
Crays Circle needs location services for:

Location permission is required for Crays Circle to discover nearby devices via Bluetooth.\n\nThis is a standard Android requirement for Bluetooth scanning. Crays Circle does not track your location or use GPS.

Location services are standard on Android devices.\n\nCrays Circle needs location services for Bluetooth scanning to work properly (Android requirement). Without this, the app cannot discover nearby users.
Note: You can change this setting later in Android Settings > Apps > Crays Circle > Permissions
Crays Circle needs these permissions to function
Crays Circle requires several permissions to create a mesh network and communicate with nearby devices. These permissions are standard for Bluetooth-based apps.
